instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
My Reference only: Ticket # REF1124.

Board has liquid damage. I was getting video prior, now I am not getting video. The board is heating up. There is quite a few audio sections that got burnt at some point but I would imagine this has nothing to do with the video?
<RESISTOR>R3453</RESISTOR> Pin 1 in diode mode reads 2.235. This area the diode (<DIODE>D3452</DIODE>) next to it I had to repair the traces. I get no voltage coming through.
<RESISTOR>R7140</RESISTOR> pin 2 is 3.3
<RESISTOR>R7155</RESISTOR> no voltage
<RESISTOR>R1501</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R1503</RESISTOR> no voltage
<TRANSISTOR>Q1930</TRANSISTOR> 1 and 2 pin no voltage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q3450</TRANSISTOR>/60 vias don't work at same time; depends which port the charger is connected.
If USB-C meter switches to 20V on both ports, there is no problem with CC1/2 pins, or something else on USB-C area.

"<RESISTOR>R7140</RESISTOR> pin 2 is 3.3"
Then CPU core is present; what's the voltage after 10-15s?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 98693, member: 682"]
Then CPU core is present; what's the voltage after 10-15s?
[/QUOTE]
At first pin 2 is at 3.3, then after 15 or so seconds, it drops to 0, then it went back up to 3.3 after another 10 or so seconds.

Don't know if this is relevant but I also get NO voltage on <SIGNAL>CPUVR_FB_R_3</SIGNAL> at all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Try again, checking CPU core voltage at pin 2 of L7210; you can't get 3V there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
I am getting pulsing anywhere from 0v to .05v.
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 98718, member: 682"]
Try again, checking CPU core voltage at pin 2 of L7210; you can't get 3V there.
[/QUOTE]
0v

When I try to chase this backwards, I do get 3.4v at <SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_ISENSE</SIGNAL>, but next down the line <SIGNAL>CPUVR_ISUM_IOUT</SIGNAL> I get 0v. Thermal cam shows the areas it is heating up at when plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
Is <CHIP>U5600</CHIP> soldered on the board?
If not, don't bother with that area.

Seems that you don't get CPU core voltage at all.
Do you get voltage at L7730 and L7370?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
No <CHIP>U5600</CHIP> is not, however I decided to check pin 5 in diode mode and noticed it is supposed to be .351 but I get .402. 
Moving on...
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 98722, member: 682"]
Do you get voltage at L7730 and L7370?
[/QUOTE]
L7730: 1.053
L7370: 1.048

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
There may be accumulated crap underneath CPU.
Try to heat with quality flux.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 98754, member: 682"]
There may be accumulated crap underneath CPU.
Try to heat with quality flux.
[/QUOTE]
No go. This board does have a bit of audio lines (Speaker Amp according to schematics) that have been burned, but they all seem to be at the proper voltage. Like around <CAPACITOR>C6464</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: I suspect bad CPU on this...
